intro: Ingenhoussia tortilis, commonly known as the curly-stemmed milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, spirally twisted stems. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Its milky sap is toxic and can cause skin irritation, making it important to handle with care. Ingenhoussia tortilis is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
